contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionary|adventure}} An '''[[adventure]]''' is an undertaking into the unknown, often having a connotation of danger and excitement. '''Adventure''' or '''The Adventure''' may also refer to: {{tocright}} == Arts and entertainment == * [[Adventure fiction]], a narrative genre * [[Adventure film]], a film genre * [[Adventure game]], a computer game genre * [[Adventure (role-playing games)]], a scripted plot line in role-playing games * [[The Adventure Company]], a Canadian video game publisher === Titled works === ==== Games ==== * [[Adventure (1979 video game)|''Adventure'' (1979 video game)]], a video game for the Atari 2600 * [[Adventure (Dungeons & Dragons)|Adventure (''Dungeons & Dragons'')]], a module or scenario for ''Dungeons & Dragons'' * ''[[Adventure!]]'', a pulp fiction role-playing game by White Wolf * ''[[Colossal Cave Adventure]]'', a 1976 text-based computer game also known as "Adventure" * [[Adventure (1982 video game)|''Adventure'' (1982 video game)]], an 8-bit computer game published in the UK by Micro Power * ''[[Castlevania: The Adventure]]'', a Game Boy game based on the ''Castlevania'' series ==== Music ==== * [[Adventure (Television album)|''Adventure'' (Television album)]] * [[Adventure (Furslide album)|''Adventure'' (Furslide album)]] * "[[The Adventure]]", a 2005 song by Angels & Airwaves * "Adventure", a song by [[Eleanor (singer)|Eleanor]] ==== Film and TV ==== * [[Adventure (1925 film)|''Adventure'' (1925 film)]], a film by Victor Fleming * [[Adventure (1945 film)|''Adventure'' (1945 film)]], a film starring Clark Gable and Greer Garson * [[Adventure (2011 film)|''Adventure'' (2011 film)]], an Hungarian film * [[Adventure (TV series)|''Adventure'' (TV series)]], a 1953 documentary series on CBS * ''[[L'Avventura]]'' (''The Adventure''), a 1960 Italian film directed by Michelangelo Antonioni * [[The Adventure (1974 film)|''The Adventure'' (1974 film)]] (''Al-Mughamara''), a Syrian film * ''[[Adventure Time]]'', a hit American animated series * [[Adventure Inc.]], a 2002 television series ==Ships== * {{HMS|Adventure}}, several ships of the Royal Navy * [[Adventure (ship)|''Adventure'' (ship)]], an American sailing vessel built in 1791 * [[Adventure (schooner)|''Adventure'' (schooner)]], an American sailing vessel built in 1926 * [[Adventure (1850)|''Adventure'' (1850)]], a schooner * [[Adventure (1834)|''Adventure'' (1834)]], a sloop * ''[[Adventure Galley]]'', an English ship captained by William Kidd, the notorious privateer turned pirate ==Other uses== * [[Adventure, Guyana]], a village * [[Mitsubishi Adventure]] or Freeca, a compact MPV sold in the Philippines * [[Adventure magazine]], a pulp (and later true-story) magazine from 1910 to 1971 * [[Adventure Comics]], a comic book series published by DC Comics from 1935 to 1983 ==See also== * [[Adventures Unlimited (disambiguation)]] {{disambig}}
